Rebecca Firkser Once that test was completed, I made raw kale pesto (with olive oil, toasted almonds, garlic, finely grated Parmesan and lemon juice) to test each blender’s ability to break down fibrous leafy greens and hard nuts. During this test, I noted which models finely chopped the pesto into a uniformly chunky sauce, as opposed to simply turning it into an ultra-emulsified savory smoothie. I then pulsed ice and water in each blender to see which were capable of making crushed ice, which you might want for cocktails or other drinks. To wrap up, I made a vinaigrette in the best-performing blenders, as each expert I consulted said they love using the countertop devices for salad dressing. (I used olive oil, red wine vinegar, shallot and Dijon mustard.) I also assessed the ease of cleaning throughout. After the smoothie test, I rinsed each blender cup with hot water, then ran the cup (and to-go lid, if listed as dishwasher-safe) through the dishwasher. Then, I hand-washed the blades and other remaining pieces, according to each brand’s directions. After the pesto test, I rinsed each blender cup and blade with hot water, added a cup of room-temperature water and a small pump of dish soap to the cup, screwed the blade back on and then ran the blender again for 30 seconds to “self-clean” the vessel. After rinsing out the soapy water with hot water, I air-dried the pieces. Then, I smelled the cups to see if any had residual garlic odor. How To Pick A Personal Blender Thinking of adding one of these compact blenders to your arsenal of kitchen devices? Here are the most important factors to keep in mind as you shop. Capacity Most personal blenders can accommodate between 16 and 32 ounces, making them ideal for whipping up small batches of a smoothie, salad dressing, pesto and more. If you want the option to make smoothies for two, for example, opt for a model on the higher end of that range. Just keep in mind that the larger the capacity, the more cabinet space the piece requires. If you’re concerned about storage, ask yourself these questions, offered by Khawaja: “How much space is this going to take on my counter? Is there room in my cabinet? Is it going to be too tall so I’ll have to put it sideways in my cabinet, or does it disassemble in two parts and I can put it side by side?” Power “I’ll always look at the wattage,” says food stylist Drew Aichele, who says he’s “pretty brutal” with his personal blender, using it often for blended margaritas and finely grating firm cheese. Most personal blenders fall in the range between 175 watts and 1,000 watts. If you want a blender that can handle ice and other frozen foods, it’s best to opt for a higher wattage. Otherwise, you might need to break up food into smaller chunks or pieces for the blender to process completely. Ease Of Use And Cleaning If a personal blender is challenging to put together, annoying to blend or a pain to clean, there’s a good chance you won’t find yourself reaching for it in the kitchen. While most personal blenders operate hands-free (once you lock the cup into place, the model runs), some more basic models have cups that need to be held in place for the machine to work. The latter does offer more control—think of using the “pulse” function on a food processor—though it’s objectively less convenient. Additionally, if you don’t like to hand-wash your dishes, check to make sure the model you’re eyeing has dishwasher-safe parts. Price Generally speaking, a personal blender will set you back anywhere between $50 and $150, though some models fall outside this range. (Smeg, for instance, has a retro-inspired model that retails for $170.) Models from direct-to-consumer brands like Beast and Our Place are typically more expensive, as they’re designed with both aesthetics and performance in mind. Less souped-up models from brands like Magic Bullet and Ninja, on the other hand, are comparatively inexpensive. Additionally, the higher the capacity, the more expensive the model tends to be. If you’re just looking for something basic to make single-serving smoothies and the occasional pesto or dressing, you can likely get away with a less powerful and more affordable model. My Expertise I’m a writer, recipe developer, recipe tester, food stylist and culinary producer with nearly a decade of experience, and I’ve worked for Food52, Bon Appétit, Epicurious, Taste, the Strategist and NYT Cooking (among other food publications). For Forbes Vetted, I’ve tested and reviewed the best carbon steel pans, and I wrote an accompanying cleaning guide. I also—and this is relevant to this article—have used quite a few blenders throughout my career, from standard versions to immersion blenders. I also spoke with three experts in the food industry who regularly use blenders in myriad styles. Carissa Stanton, author of the cookbook Seriously, So Good, uses a personal blender every day and has discovered the tool often fits her culinary needs more than upright blenders or food processors. (She loves to make extra-creamy hummus in her personal blender.) Drew Aichele is a food stylist who uses a personal blender for finely grating Parmesan cheese and whipping up crêpe batter. Fatima Khawaja is a chef and food editor who’s gotten to know her way around the countertop device through her experience as a personal chef; some of her clients only own personal models, not upright or immersion blenders, so she’s adapted recipes to fit the equipment. How Powerful Are Personal Blenders? Personal blenders are unlikely to be as powerful as upright blenders, especially high-powered models. Because there’s no way to vent a personal blender, they can’t be used for hot liquids like soup, whereas upright blender lids typically have a venting method. That said, personal blenders have their strengths. Because of their small size, they’re typically lighter in weight, easier to store and simpler to wash. What Are The Disadvantages Of Personal Blenders? The main difference between standard blenders and personal models is their size: The former have larger capacities, allowing you to make bigger batches of food. Additionally, personal blenders do not offer ventilation, so they cannot be used to blend hot ingredients. Lastly, some models (especially higher-wattage ones) can cost as much as—if not more than—no-frills standard blenders. Rebecca Firkser Following Editorial Standards Print Reprints & Permissions
news.summary: The best personal blenders are kitchen workhorses, capable of whipping up fruit smoothies, pesto and emulsified sauces with ease. Here are our top picks.
news.author: Contributor,Rebecca Firkser

news.title: Best Changing Tables 2024 - Forbes Vetted
news.text: Share to Facebook Share to Twitter Share to Linkedin Diapers and their accompanying changes are a constant of those early years in the parenthood trenches. While they’re kind of always going to, well, stink, the best changing tables certainly make cleanups a little easier—and maybe even a little cheerier (maybe). The ideal changing table, like our top pick the Babyletto Sprout 3-Drawer Changing Table, offers a sturdy spot for diaper changes, as well as additional storage for essentials like wipes, fresh onesies and, of course, the diapers. The best changing tables make diaper duty easier, while also offering storage for all the needed ... [+] supplies. Illustration: Forbes / Photos: Retailers But before purchasing a changing table, it’s important to consider the amount of space you have available, parental height and your family’s specific set of needs. You’ll need to consider safety features, too. “Having a changing station in the nursery is an excellent idea for several reasons,” says pediatrician Dr. Adrianna Bravo. “The number one reason is safety, safety, safety. Ensure your changing table or pad has guardrails or raised sides at least 2 inches high. That will act as a deterrent for the baby rolling off the table. Parents should also make it a standard practice always to keep one hand on the baby.” Here are the 10 best changing tables to consider adding to your nursery. Best Changing Table Overall: Babyletto Sprout 3-Drawer Changing Table Best Value Changing Table: Delta Children Wilmington Changing Table With Pad Best Changing Table For Small Spaces: Storkcraft Modern Changing Table & Bookcase Best Splurge Changing Table: Pottery Barn Kids Kendall Extra-Wide Nursery Dresser And Topper Set Best Freestanding Changing Table: DaVinci Jenny Lind Changing Table With Pad Best Large Changing Table: Nurture& The Dresser Best Small Dresser And Changing Table: Babyletto Hudson 3-Drawer Changer Dresser Best Changing Table And Crib Combo: Graco Hadley 5-In-1 Convertible Crib And Changer With Drawer Best Convertible Changing Table: Little Seeds Monarch Hill Haven Changing Table Dresser Best Portable Changing Table: Sweeby Portable Baby Changing Table Best Overall Changing Table Excellent Quality And Value MOST POPULAR Wayfair Babyletto Sprout 3-Drawer Changing Table Material: Pine, engineered wood | Dimensions: 41.5 x 20 x 36 inches | Convertible: Yes | Weight limit: 30 pounds | Greenguard Gold Certified: Yes The Babyletto Sprout is our top pick overall because it works so well for so many homes and families. It’s not too big or too small. It’s not too tall or too short—and it’s not too outrageously priced or too cheap. In short, this changing table and three-drawer dresser is a good option for just about any nursery. At 99 pounds, it’s sturdy and has quality craftsmanship. It’s available in three finishes. This changing table is made from pine and manufactured wood, features smooth-glide drawers and has several safety features to keep your child safe, including an anti-tip kit and drawers that don’t pull out all the way, further lowering the risk of tipping and injuries. It’s also consciously made, Greenguard certified and uses low VOC materials. Because it includes storage drawers and a removable changing topper, this piece can be used as a dresser before and after the diaper years. What the parents say: Overall the consensus is that the dresser is fantastic but can be tricky to assemble. Regardless, one reviewer called it the “perfect addition for the new nursery. Easy to put together and great quality.” Best Value Changing Table An Affordable And Popular Option Amazon Delta Children Wilmington Changing Table Material: Wood, engineered wood | Dimensions: ‎39 x 2o x 35 inches | Convertible: Yes | Weight limit: 24 pounds | Greenguard Gold Certified: No If you’re looking for an affordable changing table, consider this streamlined Delta changing table. It’s far less expensive than most other options, and is an Amazon bestseller with 8,000 reviews and an overall rating 4.8 out of 5 stars. It’s well constructed and assembly isn’t difficult. What the parents say: Parents say the beauty of this changing table is its simplicity. “I could not be more happy with this changing table. It’s beautiful, strong, and easy to assemble,” writes one reviewer. Parents also like that with the addition of a few fabric bins you can use it to store diapering essentials, toys, books and extra clothes. Once your baby becomes a big kid, it can be used as a bookshelf or a vanity. As one parent put it, it has “longevity.” Best Changing Table For Small Spaces Makes The Most Of Your Space Storkcraft Storkcraft Modern Changing Table & Bookcase Material: Engineered wood | Dimensions: 36 x 19 x 33 inches| Convertible: Yes | Weight limit: 30 pounds | Greenguard Gold Certified: Yes Thia Storkcraft changing table is slim and saves space by providing a changing table and storage/bookshelf all in one. We appreciate that it can keep all of your diapering essentials in one place during the baby years, but can also be used for storage, toys and books as your child grows. It’s even low enough that babies can help themselves to toys on the lower shelves, which promotes independent play. It’s Greenguard Gold and JPMA-certified, but doesn’t include an anti-tip kit so be sure to snag one of those, too. It’s about 33-inches in width, but reviewers seem happy with the amount of space and storage it provides. Many note, however, that putting the piece together is better done with two people and some patience. The changing topper is removable. What the parents say: Parents appreciate the height and storage options this changing table provides. One mom writes, “It was a little hard to put together, but take your time, give yourself two hours and it’s perfect. My daughter always laughs and smiles now when we are on the changing table, and with all the stuff we need underneath with her toys on the bottom, it's just perfect.” Best Splurge Changing Table Spacious Drawers For Storage To Grow With Your Family Pottery Barn Kids Pottery Barn Kids Kendall Extra-Wide Nursery Dresser And Topper Set Material: Sap gum wood, manufactured wood | Dimensions: 54.5 x 18.5 x 32.5 inches | Convertible: Yes | Weight limit: 50 pounds | Greenguard Gold Certified: Yes This Pottery Barn Kids changing table and dresser combination stands out due to its quality, style and staying power. It’s large enough that even as your baby (and their clothing size) grows, it can easily transition to a traditional full-size dresser. It’s the ideal height for parents, and the small drawers at the top are perfect for small children’s clothes and diapers. Once your baby is finished with diapers, the seven drawers work for better sorting of all their clothes. The topper can be easily removed, too. This changing table/dresser comes in five classic colors and matches the Kendall nursery collection at Pottery Barn Kids, including one of our top-choice cribs. It’s Greenguard Gold certified and made in a Fair Trade certified factory. All of Pottery Barn Kids’ furniture includes pre-tested anti-tip kits. This one also offers adjustable levelers to ensure stability no matter the condition of your floors. It arrives assembled via white glove delivery services, so you don’t have to built it yourself. What the parents say: Mom of four, McKenna Fakheri, calls this her favorite dresser. “When I compare it to the ones I purchased for my other three children, it stands out, because it has seven drawers—four large and three small,” she says. “The others are only six drawers, which allows for less designated space for socks and other miscellaneous items.” Best Freestanding Changing Table A Stylish, Streamlined Set With Open Shelves Amazon DaVinci Jenny Lind Changing Table With Pad Material: Pine, engineered wood | Dimensions: 36 x 19 x 40 inches | Convertible: Yes | Weight limit: 30 pounds | Greenguard Gold Certified: No While this DaVinci Jenny Lind changing table is similar in concept to our budget option, this piece has a more elevated look. Many families opt for changing tables with dresser drawers, but one reviewer explained why a standalone changing table is ideal for some nurseries: “Having this changing table separate from my dresser allowed me to put other things on the dresser (lamp, frames) and have everything an arm-length away. It has a small footprint, which is nice for a small space. I have been very happy with this product.” The open shelving makes it easy to grab what you need for changes, and it includes an anti-tip kit. Other reviewers noted that it’s easy to assemble and sturdy but slim. Plus, the brand offers a matching crib. What the parents say: Like many who purchased this changing table, one reviewer adored it but noted they did need to purchase a separate changing pad even though one is included. “Great changing table. It was easy to put together, it's sturdy, and it looks fabulous. The only cons are that the boards for the shelves and top seem a tiny bit flimsy,” they say. Best Large Changing Table Seven Drawers, Plus Extendable Sides Nurture& Nurture& The Dresser Material: Rubberwood, fiberboard, plywood | Dimensions: 32.5 x 54.5 x 19 inches | Convertible: Yes | Weight Limit: 150 pounds | Greenguard Gold Certified: No If you want more drawer space, this beautiful wood dresser from Nurture& might be ideal. It comes fully assembled (many options on this list take hours to put together), is timeless in style and provides plenty of space. Most notably, this option has extendable sides that allow for even more storage. The topper, which is sold separately and costs an additional $199, runs the span of the dresser, so it too offers plenty of space for diapering essentials. This means you don’t have to store them in one of the seven drawers. If you want to place other nursery essentials like a sound machine or baby monitor on the dresser, these easily fit on the extendable sides. Nurture& offers matching nursery furniture that can be bundled together for a reduced price—a plus since this changing table and dresser are on the expensive side. What the parents say: “We love that there are side table pull outs. We use them every day. Also, we love that it came all put together,” says one of many happy reviewers. Another writes: “I bought this dresser because I was so happy with the glider, I am yet again so impressed by the high quality of this piece.” Best Small Dresser And Changing Table Combo Drawers And Shelves In A Petite Package Amazon Babyletto Hudson 3-Drawer Changer Dresser Material: Pine, engineered wood | Dimensions: ‎39 x 19 x 37 inches | Convertible: Yes | Weight limit: 30 pounds | Greenguard Gold Certified: Yes There are plenty of changing table dresser combinations on the market, but this petite Babyletto piece includes several features that improve the functionality of any nursery. For one, the topper has a cordoned off space for diapering essentials like wipes and creams, and the dresser offers three compact drawers. It also matches our top crib pick, the Babyletto Hudson. We also love the two enclosed shelves that can be utilized in a way that suits your family. Keep in mind that the drawers aren’t the roomiest, so they won’t fit an older child’s clothes as your baby grows beyond toddlerhood. On top of the utility this changing table offers, it’s also Greenguard Gold certified and includes safety features like an anti-tip kit and stop mechanisms on the drawer. Just keep in mind that it requires assembly, which some parents found to be quite time-consuming. What the parents say: “I needed a small, good quality changing table for a small space (our bathroom). It looks so good and heavy in a good way. Plenty of storage and assembly was straightforward,” writes one Wayfair reviewer. A happy Amazon customer says: “This is a very sturdy changing table that I feel safe to put my baby on. It being Greenguard Gold certified gives me extra piece of mind. The drawers and door run smoothly.” Best Changing Table And Crib Combo Three Essentials In One Affordable Package Amazon Graco Hadley 5-In-1 Convertible Crib And Changer With Drawer Material: Pine wood, engineered wood, wood composites | Dimensions: 72 x 30 x 40 inches | Convertible: Yes | Weight limit: 50 pounds | Greenguard Gold Certified: No This classic looking (and affordable) crib isn’t just a place to let your baby get some shut-eye—it’s also a changing table and dresser. Plus it has additional storage space underneath it, and it coverts to a full-size daybed or toddler bed with the purchase of a conversion kit. The footprint is larger than some of the other options we’ve included, but that’s because it’s several products in one. The addition of the changing table and storage mean this combo is ideal for smaller spaces—and it makes middle-of-the-night diaper changes far easier since everything is in one place. It’s JPMA-certified as well. What the parents say: While some reviews note the long assembly time, many seem happy with this crib and changing table. As one parent wrote: “It was easy to build and the instructions [are] so easy to follow. Everything fit where it was supposed to. The storage and changing table are superb.” Best Convertible Changing Table Comes With A Removable Topper So It Grows With Your Family Wayfair Little Seeds Monarch Hill Haven Changing Table Dresser Material: Manufactured wood | Dimensions: 36 x 47 x 20 inches | Convertible: Yes | Weight limit: 100 pounds (dresser), 30 pounds (topper) | Greenguard Gold Certified: No This convertible changing table looks pricier than it is, and it’s the ideal height while not being too wide. It comes with a 1-year warranty, anti-tip kit and built-in drawer stops, so it converts to a standard dresser once your diapering days are done. The changing table topper is sold separately and there’s also a three-drawer dresser option if that better suits your needs. The drawers could be a bit smoother, but we appreciate the gold pulls, as they allow older kids to access items and feel like they’re helping. What the parents say: “When outfitting my younger son’s nursery, I searched for a changing table that was stylish, practical, midsize and something that could last for years while not blowing my budget,” says co-author Lex Goodman. “Having purchased a similar looking option for my older son, this Little Seeds changing table dresser appeared to be perfect. While it did take a couple of hours for my husband to assemble, we were extremely pleased with the size, value and style of the dresser,” she says. Best Portable Changing Table Adjustable, Foldable And Ready To Move Amazon Sweeby Portable Baby Changing Table Material: Metal, plastics | Dimensions: 33.5 x 2o x 39 inches | Convertible: No | Weight limit: N/A | Greenguard Gold Certified: No This lightweight changing table folds up and slides into narrow spaces for more compact living situations. Thanks to the lockable universal wheels, it can also be moved all around the home or remain stationary, so you can comfortably change your baby in the nursery, living room, bathroom or wherever else. It includes two shelves, two side pockets, a storage basket and a hanging clothes rail, so you can easily reach diapering and clothing essentials. The fabric is waterproof and easy to clean off, and we love that the whole table is height adjustable up or down, with four locking heights and a frame suitable for parents 4-foot-8 to 6 feet tall. Given these specs and its mobility, it seems a particularly good option for the newborn days and for families planning to have more than one child. What the parents say: With an overall 4.5 out of 5 rating on Amazon, the reviews for this mobile changing table highlight its convenience and ease of use. “Wish I bought this sooner and saved my back. My baby likes being on this more than his bassinet...It also has huge amount of storage and holds a lot of diapers & wet wipes below,” says one parent. MORE FROMFORBES VETTED Samsung Unpacked 2024 Debuts New Foldable Phones, A Smart Ring And More By Christian de Looper Contributor Casper One Mattress Review: Comfort With A New And Improved Design By McKenzie Dillon Forbes Staff Why Trust Forbes Vetted Our knowledgeable team of parenting editors and writers have extensive experience reviewing and testing baby sleep products for safety, quality and usefulness. Our in-depth nursery and baby furniture coverage includes shopping guides on everything from the best cribs to the best rockers and gliders. We also work to answer readers’ parenting questions, such as how to design a nursery and when to transition your child to a toddler bed. The authors of this article, Elizabeth Mitchell Kadar and Lex Goodman, as well as baby and kids gear editor Margaret Badore—are all moms themselves. We are journalists with in-depth product review experience. Our recommendations are consistent with the American Academy of Pediatrics’ advice on changing tables. We regularly update this article for freshness and accuracy. It was last updated in July 2024 by Goodman. We also consulted the following pediatricians: Dr. Adrianna Bravo is a board certified pediatrician, Fellow of the American Academy of Pediatrics, the Chief Medical Officer of Inspire Medical Group and a school health consultant; and Dr. Rebekah Diamond, a pediatrician and author of Parent Like A Pediatrician. How We Chose The Best Changing Tables To pick the best changing tables we interviewed pediatricians and spoke with parents across the country to find the best options on the market. We look for baby gear that’s safe, helpful and practical in different use-cases. As parents of young children with a total of five combined kids between the authors, we drew on our firsthand knowledge of using changing tables. We read online reviews to garner more feedback from real families and experts. We also connected with parents in our personal and online communities to provide additional feedback. We only considered changing tables with overwhelmingly positive reviews and an average star rating of 4 or above. We made sure to adhere to the American Academy of Pediatrics’ guidelines on changing tables. After looking through reviews and discussing these items with parents, we determine if an item should be included. We selected changing tables that meet the needs of a wide range of little ones, including options for different budges, design style and taste. What Is The Safest Changing Table? Bravo says purchasing a safe changing table partly comes down to where you plan to place it. Ideally, parents should place the changing table in a “space free from anything the baby can grab or become entangled in” and be mindful about having supplies close at hand, so you aren’t leaving baby unattended while you grab another diaper. “Simply put, parents need to keep three words in mind while shopping for a changing table: safety, storage and hygiene. Once you meet those three criteria, the rest is up to personal preference,” she says. Bravo also points out that it’s ideal to look for a changing table or pad with raised sides or guardrails to minimize baby rolling off. We’ve also noted which changing tables on this list come with anti-tip kits and other important safety features, such as drawers that won’t tumble out or all at once, as well as those certified to be free of certain chemicals and off-gassing. If your changing table has wheels, keep them locked while not moving the table to prevent accidents. Is It Worth Buying A Changing Table? Most parents find worthwhile to have a designated changing table, which you can stock with diapers, wipes, diaper cream, changes of clothing and even small toys to entertain your child while you clean them up. Dr. Rebekah Diamond, pediatrician and author of Parent Like A Pediatrician, also notes that a changing table is helpful from a convenience standpoint, “since you don’t have to bend down or move around a changing surface.” Changing your baby on the floor or a bed can be hard on your back and shoulders. “There’s definitely an appeal from a nursery design and aesthetics perspective which is totally okay,” she says. Of course, you can turn any sturdy dresser of the appropriate height into a changing table with the addition of a changing pad. However, it’s important to make sure the piece of furniture you choose can support your baby’s weight. Changing tables that are designed explicitly for use with babies (like those on this lista) have the advantage of coming with the manufacturer’s recommended weight limit. Bravo notes that a changing table can also help establish a routine for parents and babies. “A changing table will be where parents change diapers, prepare the baby for bath time and dress the baby,” she says. “Regularity can be essential to create a soothing daily routine.” It’s also a more hygienic option than diaper changes on the bedding or rug, she points out. However, many of us are short on space or constrained by budget concerns, especially when considering all the stuff suggested to stock a nursery for your baby’s first year of life. That’s why a changing table/dresser combination might deliver the most value for your family, or you may prefer a more inexpensive, temporary solution for use just during the busiest of diaper seasons: the first year. The key is to consider your space and individual family’s needs. Do Changing Tables Need Straps? While not all changing tables and changing pads include straps, they are a helpful safety tool to reduce the risk of a baby rolling off the changing table. According to the American Academy of Pediatrics’ advice, parents and caretakers should “always supervise their child on a changing table, even when buckled.” They also note that “the changing table should have a guardrail around all sides, and the top should be slightly lower than the sides. Keep diapering supplies within your reach but away from your baby’s reach. Place babies to sleep in a safe sleep environment, not on a changing table.” If your changing table doesn’t include a changing strap (and even if it does), it's best to follow the advice of Dr. Bravo and “make it a standard practice always to keep one hand on the baby” when they’re on the changing table. Consider keeping a stocked diaper caddy close at hand on your changing table, so you have everything you need right there.
news.summary: The best changing tables create a safe, stylish and hygienic place for diaper changes. Here are top picks for all types of nurseries.
news.author: Contributor,Lex Goodman

news.title: Best Subscription Boxes For Women 2024 - Forbes Vetted
news.text: Share to Facebook Share to Twitter Share to Linkedin Whether you’re treating a special someone or want to explore a new interest for yourself, subscription boxes are a fun way to discover new products on a regular basis. From the popular Ipsy beauty box and personalized styles from Stitch Fix to more niche offerings, like Bookbrews’ coffee and book pairings, our shopping editors searched high and low for the best subscription boxes for women. The best subscription boxes for women in 2024 include BookBrews, StitchFix, Therabox and more. ILLUSTRATION: FORBES / PHOTO: RETAILERS While the offerings are diverse, our favorite curations have one thing in common: Each comes packed with an array of top-notch products delivered monthly, quarterly or at the cadence of your choice. Below, find 28 of the best subscription boxes for women, which also happen to make thoughtful last-minute gifts. (Plus, we’ve also rounded up a slew of subscription boxes for men and subscription boxes for moms to treat the special people in your life.) MORE FROMFORBES VETTED Samsung Unpacked 2024 Debuts New Foldable Phones, A Smart Ring And More By Christian de Looper Contributor Casper One Mattress Review: Comfort With A New And Improved Design By McKenzie Dillon Forbes Staff Most Popular Subscription Boxes For Women Best Beauty Subscription Box For Women: Ipsy Best Fashion Subscription Box For Women: Stitch Fix Best Lifestyle Subscription Box For Women: FabFitFun Most Unique Subscription Box For Women: Bookbrews Best Flower Subscription Box For Women: The Bouqs Co. Best Self-Care Subscription Box For Women: TheraBox Best Food Subscription Box For Women: Universal Yums Best Coffee Subscription Box For Women: Trade Coffee Best Alcohol Subscription Box For Women: Firstleaf Best Beauty Subscription Boxes For Women A Popular Option With Something For Everyone IPSY Ipsy Personalized Monthly Makeup & Beauty Subscription Delivery frequency: Monthly | Shipping: Free in U.S. and Mexico The Ipsy box is a no-brainer for anyone who’s obsessed with all things beauty. Best of all, it’s an option that caters to every budget, so you can customize your package based on how much you want to spend. For instance, the $14 option includes five beauty products worth up to $70, while for $30, you get five full-size products worth up to $200. Plus, you get to sample products from top-notch beauty brands like Tatcha, Tarte, Glossier and more. An Affordable Way To Stock Up On Designer Scents Scentbird Scentbird Delivery frequency: Monthly | Shipping: Free in the U.S. Full-size perfume bottles are expensive, which often limits the number of bottles you can add to your vanity lineup. But with Scentbird, you discover a wide range of new perfumes every month. Start with a quiz and customize your preferences, after which the brand sends you miniature bottles of perfume from major designers like Versace, Prada and Dolce & Gabbana. As a bonus, your first box is half off ($8.47) and includes a sleek reusable spray bottle. A Special Treat For Beauty Lovers Allure Allure Beauty Box Delivery frequency: Monthly | Shipping: Free in contiguous U.S. Curated by the folks at Allure magazine, the Allure Beauty Box is a great way to sample expensive beauty and skincare products (think brands like Elemis, L’Occitane and 111Skin to name a few) without investing in full sizes. That said, it does treat subscribers to three full-size items along with six smaller-sized products worth over $100, plus a free gift for first time recipients. Shipping is always free and the subscription includes access to exclusive discounts and events, as well. Best Fashion Subscription Boxes For Women Inclusive And Caters To All Ages And Sizes Stitch Fix Stitch Fix Delivery frequency: Monthly | Shipping: Free Stitch Fix features clothes for women of all ages and styles with the advice of an expert stylist, to boot. First, members answer a style quiz, then a personal stylist curates five picks before they’re shipped out. Pricing is a little different from other services, as a $20 styling fee is paid up front, then members buy any items they like. Two nice perks: The styling fee is credited toward the purchase of those items, or you can use it to give someone a gift card toward future purchases. Rent Styles From Anthropologie, Free People And More Editor’s Pick Nuuly Nuuly Clothing Subscription Box Delivery frequency: Monthly | Shipping: Free Offering a curated collection of styles from brands like Anthropologie, Free People, Good American and more, Nuuly’s clothing subscription box presents the opportunity to rock on-trend pieces without the commitment of purchasing them. For $98, you get to choose any six garments to rent and wear over the next month. (Laundry and repairs are included in the initial fee.) Senior deals editor Kara Cuzzone is a fan, saying the box is “a great way to try out new trends without giving in to fast fashion.” She adds that it’s also incredibly easy to pause and unpause your membership. If you fall in love with a particular dress or pair of jeans, you can purchase it directly from Nuuly. Stylist-Curated And Steers Clear Of Fast Fashion Sustainable Cratejoy A Curated Thrift Monthly Box Delivery frequency: Monthly | Shipping: Free Not a fan of fast fashion but love vintage finds? A Curated Thrift’s monthly clothing subscription box is for you. Choose your aesthetic (from classic to Barbiecore) and a few styles from the online catalog, then fill out a quiz and stylist will reach out to further customize your look. The result: Five handpicked pieces sourced from resale and vintage shops—and the option to return and exchange each item. While the entire subscription is paid up front (from one month to a full year), you can save 15% off the total this season with code CJSAVE15. Best Lifestyle Subscription Boxes For Women A Curated Box With Mostly Full-Size Products FabFitFun FabFitFun Delivery frequency: Monthly | Shipping: Free in contiguous U.S. FabFitFun’s members can choose from a little bit of everything: Past items have included a plush robe, Kate Spade stud earrings, designer makeup and a set of Lilly Pulitzer mugs. Each quarterly box is valued at $200 but only costs $60 (and if you choose an annual plan, it’s only $55). Another cool thing: Members can also opt to let FabFitFun surprise them with picks. Gearing up for Amazon’s Prime Day sales? FabFitFun’s version (aptly named FabFit FunWeek) is coming up: From July 11 through July 17, members will get up to 75% off full-sized items and bundles; meanwhile, seasonal memberships will be 20% off. Trendy Intimates, Sleepwear And More At A Discount Sustainable Adore Me Adore Me VIP Membership Delivery frequency: Monthly | Shipping: Free Online intimates retailer Adore Me, known for its stylish intimates, offers two monthly memberships. The VIP membership pulls $40 per month to be used as store credit; you also score discounted pricing from 40% to 50% off retail (and newbies get an additional 50% off). Every sixth set you shop is free, and you can skip a month before the 6th. Plus, any credits you accumulate never expire. There’s also the Elite Home Try-On membership, a lingerie-only monthly subscription in which in-house stylists match you with four to seven pieces per month. It’s a “try before you buy” system accompanied by a $20 styling fee, which is credited toward anything you decide to keep. A Luxe Box Of Rachel Zoe-Approved Products CURATEUR Curateur The Curation Delivery frequency: Quarterly | Shipping: Free on orders over $50 Sometimes we want to pamper ourselves with only the best products—but don’t have time to put in the research. Curateur solves that problem with its seasonal The Curation Box, which is packed with full-sized fashion and beauty items that have all been approved by tastemaker Rachel Zoe herself. Each quarterly box is worth over $600 (after all, all the products are full-sized) and contains upscale finds like a Wanderlust + Co chain link bracelet and the Overnight Repair skincare set by Avant. Most Unique Subscription Boxes For Women More Than A Regular Book Subscription Etsy Bookbrews Book Subscription Box Delivery frequency: Monthly | Shipping: Free This monthly subscription box doesn’t just bring you reading material; it encourages you to take a little time to indulge. Along with a book from your recipient’s favorite genre, the box also includes tea or coffee and high-quality chocolate. The reviews are incredibly positive, and best of all, you’ll be supporting a small business. Practical, Unique Items For The Outdoor Explorer Cratejoy Wild Woman Box Delivery frequency: Monthly | Shipping: $7.95 Avid hikers and outdoorsy folks will find plenty of useful—and oftentimes surprising, according to many reviews—outdoor-inspired items in Wild Woman Box’s monthly package. We’re impressed with the diversity in each collection; you get cool gear like emergency blankets and inflatable lanterns, body care products like anti-chafing lotion and bug bite relief, and of course, healthy trail snacks you may not have heard of. A Creative Box To Liven Up Date Night The Adventure Challenge The Adventure Box Subscription Delivery frequency: Monthly | Shipping: Free This subscription box from The Adventure Challenge is perfect for those who could use a little date night inspiration. For less than the price of an upscale dinner, you get an assortment of curated offerings that allow you to try a new, creative activity right at home. Every month presents a different challenge that encourages exploration, connection and laughter. Best Flower Subscription Boxes For Women For Fresh Blooms Suitable For A Nancy Meyer Film Best Features The Bouqs Co. The Bouqs Co. Flower Subscription Delivery frequency: Weekly, biweekly, monthly or bimonthly | Shipping: Free The Bouqs Co. has built up an army of fans, and for good reason: The brand ships gorgeous bouquets that look much more expensive than they actually are. (It’s also our top pick in our Best Flower Delivery Services story.) The Bouqs’ subscription program lets you choose from several delivery options, as well as the following bouquet options: Original (featuring 10 to 16 stems), Deluxe (20 to 32 stems) and Grand (30 to 45 stems). Plus, all subscribers get 30% off additional bouquets along with a monthly $10 credit. Gorgeous Pre-Planted Sets Of Seasonal Bulbs Harry & David Harry & David Bulb-Of-The-Month Club Delivery frequency: Monthly | Shipping: $8 Growing your own flowers from seeds can feel intimidating, which is why Harry & David’s Bulb-Of-The-Month Club makes a great gift for budding gardeners. The first set of seasonal bulbs arrives pre-planted in a decorative planter—you can expect to see blooms in just 2 to 4 weeks. Every month, the bulbs change depending on the season: In the summer, you can expect colorful begonias, hyacinths and lilies; the fall will bring bulbs like paperwhites and amaryllis. A Sweet (And Fuss-Free) Surprise For Plant Parents Succulents Box Succulents Box Delivery frequency: Monthly | Shipping: Around $5.50 Unlike elaborate houseplants, succulents require very little care and it’s hard to kill them even if you forget to water them for weeks. This is why succulents are ideal gifts for budding plant parents who have a hard time keeping their green babies alive. At Succulents Box, you can choose between gifting one to four succulents for a time period of 1 to 12 months. The most basic subscription includes only a plastic pot and soil, but higher-end options are available for those who want clay pots delivered with each monthly package. Best Self-Care Subscription Boxes For Women Wellness Products And Activities Curated By Therapists MOST POPULAR Therabox TheraBox Self-Care Subscription Box Delivery frequency: Monthly | Shipping: $5 The monthly self-care box TheraBox is designed to help rewire your brain to make more positive neural connections—basically, to inspire happiness and self-love. How? In the form of this monthly subscription box packed with full-size self-care and wellness products selected with the help of therapists. In each box, you get one research-inspired, joy-boosting activity, like journaling, brain-training exercises, stress-reduction card decks and more. You’ll also find eight or nine self-care goodies that range from skincare to aromatherapy to soothing teas. Customizable, Sustainable Period Care Whenever You Need It Gives Back August August Build A Box Period Subscription Delivery frequency: Every 1 to 6 months | Shipping: $7 (free with $50 purchase) Instead of crossing your fingers that you’re stocked up for when that time of the month arrives, Gen Z-founded period care brand August offers an alternative with its monthly subscription box. Choose the quantity of each period product (up to 96 units per item) and your shipping frequency; you’ll get 10% off items and be able to modify or cancel your subscription any time. You can feel good about August’s 100% organic cotton products, too: Each purchase contributes directly to period poverty-reduction initiatives (like taking a stand against the “tampon tax”). Practice Self-Care Through Journaling Silk + Sonder Silk + Sonder Membership Delivery frequency: Monthly | Shipping: Free You get more than just a new journal with Silk and Sonder’s guided self-care membership. Each month’s box contains a themed wellness journal that also functions as a planner and habit tracker, guided recordings to accompany your writing, virtual workshops, and access to an online community of other members to build a peer-to-peer support network. The goal is to reduce stress and build healthy habits while taking up just five minutes per day. Get Natural Artisan Candles Paired With A Matching Playlist USA-Made vellabox Vellabox Delivery frequency: Monthly | Shipping: Free Candle lovers, rejoice: Vellabox’s candle subscription is here to help you set the perfect mood. Choose your preferred candle size (from four to 16 ounces) and scent profile, and you’ll get your tailored candle every month. The brand’s candles are hand-poured in small batches by U.S. artisans, made with all-natural ingredients and delivered in eco-friendly packaging. You’ll also receive a surprise lifestyle product and an accompanying playlist to get the vibes going. Best Food Subscription Boxes For Women A Box Of Surprises For The Adventurous Snacker Universal Yums Universal Yums Subscription Box Alas, we can’t always hop on the next flight to Belgium or Greece when we’re craving authentic crème brûlée bonbons or baklava. Enter: Universal Yums’ monthly snack box. Every shipment contains a selection of sweet and savory snacks from the country featured that month, whether it’s chocolate-covered waffles from the Netherlands or pineapple candy from Thailand. You also get a guidebook with trivia and games. Finished all the goodies before the month is over? You can buy your favorite snack individually from the Universal Yums shop. Delicious Snacks That Beat Your Local Bodega Options the goods mart The Goods Mart The Best Of The Best Delivery frequency: Monthly | Shipping: Free These aren’t your standard bodega snacks. The Goods Mart delivers what it calls “the best of the best” of the snacks it sells in its brick-and-mortar store in New York City. You’ll get thoughtfully curated snacks from emerging companies, with a delicious mix of sweet and savory (and chewy and crunch) in every box. Snackers can expect goodies from “better for you,” mission-driven brands, including small-batch za’atar pita chips from ZaZa Snacks, cult-favorite vegan sun-popped popcorn by Bjorn Qorn and baked cheddar cheese balls from Pipcorn. Plus, you can choose to make your box gluten-free, vegan or paleo. Savor A Night In With Wine And Cheese harry & david Wine & Cheese Pairing Club Delivery frequency: Monthly | Shipping: $10 There are cheese lovers, there are wine lovers—and then there are those of us who can’t have one without the other. You’ll be able to keep your fridge stocked with the perfect pairing of vino and fromage thanks to Harry & David’s Wine and Cheese Pairing Club. Each month, you get a bottle shipped directly from the company’s Oregon vineyard, alongside American cheeses like cheddar rubbed with salt and honey from Utah-based Beehive Cheese Company and a cheddar-Jack blend from Rogue Creamery in Oregon. Decadent Chocolate Bars In Exciting Flavors Compartés Compartés Gourmet Chocolate Of The Month Club Delivery frequency: Monthly | Shipping: Free If you know someone with a sweet tooth, consider gifting them with a Chocolate of the Month Club subscription from California-based Compartés. Every month, the brand sends a selection of seasonal, handmade chocolate bars and truffles to your doorstep. For the holidays, your recipient will receive confections with flavors like Cinnamon Toast, S’mores and more. Meanwhile, you’ll see seasonal favorites in the summer months—and even a mystery box in August. Best Coffee And Tea Subscription Boxes For Women A Must-Have For Coffee Lovers Best Features Trade Coffee Trade Coffee Subscription Delivery frequency: Weekly, biweekly or every 10 days | Shipping: Free The top pick in our best coffee subscriptions story, Trade Coffee has teamed up with 400 roasting companies (including smaller brands) from around the country, ranging from Merit Coffee to Good Citizen. Take a quiz to match up with varieties that suit your tastes, then decide how often you want the coffee delivered. Each bag of coffee usually costs between $16 and $22 on its own, and subscription holders get access to exclusive savings and free shipping. (Bonus: You get 30% off your first subscription order.) Tour The World, One Tea At A Time atlas Atlas Tea Club Delivery frequency: Monthly | Shipping: $4.95 Traveling tea lovers, listen up: Atlas’ Tea Club is the perfect way to quench your wanderlust. Each box comes with two loose-leaf teas from the featured country (guaranteed single-origin and specialty-grade), an informative postcard, tasting notes and tips, and disposable tea filters. Choose the type package you want (pure, blended or a variety), as well as the type of tea you prefer, from flavored to herbal. Past teas have come from Japan, Nepal, India and more. Best Alcohol Subscription Boxes For Women A Fun Way To Discover Delicious New Wines Firstleaf Firstleaf Delivery frequency: Every 2, 4 or 6 weeks | Shipping: Free for first order and 12-bottle plans; otherwise $14.95 Firstleaf’s wine subscription is the perfect gift for the wine connoisseur in your life—or yourself. You or your lucky recipient answers a quick questionnaire, after which they’ll receive a box of six or 12 wines catered to their taste buds. With each box, the more they rate their wines, the more personalized their experience will get. Firstleaf also offers credit back for wines they didn’t enjoy, and its shipping policies are flexible so they can choose how often they want a box dropped off at their doorstep. A Box For Elevating Cocktail Hour Shaker & Spoon Shaker & Spoon Cocktail Club Delivery frequency: Monthly | Shipping: $8 If you or your giftee prefers cocktails over wine, consider updating your home bars with a Shaker & Spoon subscription. At the start of every month, you’ll receive a box packed with plenty of ingredients necessary to make three brand-new and original cocktail recipes, all created by bar industry experts. Syrups, bitters, garnishes, mixers, fresh citrus—it’s all included. (You can get the booze delivered, too, with the help of an alcohol delivery service.) Elevated Cocktails—Without The Alcohol We Are Raising The Bar Raising The Bar Zero-Proof Box Delivery frequency: Monthly | Shipping: $10 Miss happy hour but ditching the alcohol? Channel your inner mixologist with Raising the Bar’s themed subscription boxes. Each month, you get zero-proof ingredients and detailed instructions to make three cocktails (12 servings total), as well as bar tools, garnishes and other accessories. Themes include Garden Party, which highlights springtime flavors like strawberry and lavender, and Smokeshow, which features mezcal and the bold Lapsang Souchong black tea. Are Subscription Boxes For Women Ever Worth It? It depends on your budget and lifestyle. For those who have the extra income and want the convenience of getting personalized, curated items delivered right to their door, subscription boxes may be worth the investment. Many subscription boxes—like Ipsy’s Makeup And Beauty Subscription and Firstleaf’s Wine Club—also provide several full-sized items from your favorite brands (ones you might buy individually at different retailers) in one package at a considerable discount. Still, it might be hard for some people to justify the recurring costs associated with subscription boxes—unless they purchase them as gifts. Luckily, several companies—including Scentbird, The Bouqs and Trade Coffee—allow you to prepay for several months’ worth of boxes. That way, you won’t be on the hook for a recurring charge and your recipient gets to enjoy a gift that keeps on giving. What Is The Average Price Of Subscription Boxes? Subscription boxes for women average anywhere from $10 to $100 per box or shipment—though price varies greatly depending on the type of goods each contains. On the lower end of the cost spectrum, for instance, you can sign up for a plant subscription from Succulent Box for as low as $5 a month or a small-batch candle box from Vellabox starting at $12 a month. On the other hand, gourmet chocolates from Compartés cost at least $49.60 per shipment, while each box of luxury fashion and beauty items from Rachel Zoe’s The Curateur Curation is priced at $112.50.
news.summary: From succulents to craft cocktails, we rounded up our 28 favorite subscription boxes for women that also make great gifts (hint, hint).
news.author: Forbes Staff,Fran Sales

news.title: Most Comfortable Slides 2024 - Forbes Vetted
news.text: Share to Facebook Share to Twitter Share to Linkedin The most comfortable slides are breathable, easy to slip into and provide enough support and cushioning so you can wear them for hours. After testing out a variety of pairs and interviewing North Carolina-based podiatrist Dr. Elizabeth Bass Daughtry, DPM, we determined that Oofos’ Ooahh Slide Sandal is one of the most comfortable slides out there. For a supportive pick, Lululemon Restfeel Slide scored high in our testing, as did Hoka Ora Recovery Slide 3. The most comfortable slides are breathable, easy to slip into and provide enough support and ... [+] cushioning so you can wear them for hours. ILLUSTRATION: FORBES / PHOTO: RETAILERS According to Dr. Daughtry, a slide with arch support, a deep heel cup and contoured footbed can make all the difference for longterm comfort. Super flat styles that don’t support the foot can lead to pain and other issues. Based on our firsthand testing, we found the most comfortable slides whether you’re running errands, going on short walks or just lounging at home. Most Comfortable Slides Overall: Oofos Ooahh Slide Sandal Most Comfortable Foam Slides: Crocs Mellow Reovery Slide Most Comfortable Lightweight Slides: Lululemon Restfeel Slide Most Comfortable Supportive Slides: Kuru Breeze Most Comfortable Recovery Slides: Hoka Ora Recovery Slide 3 Most Comfortable Platform Slides: Reef Cushion Bondi Bay Most Affordable Comfortable Slides: Adidas Adilette Comfort Slides Most Comfortable Stylish Slides: Birkenstock Madrid Big Buckle Most Comfortable Slide Overall Oofos: Impact-Absorbing And Easy To Wear OOFOS Oofos Ooahh Slide Sandal Our score: 10 | Sizes: 5 to 16 | Colors: 10 total, including Cosmic Gray and Navy | Materials: Closed cell foam This cushiony slide is frequently featured in our footwear guides—and for good reason. The Ooahh provides the right blend of comfort, support and impact absorption—37% more than other footwear, according to the brand. The foam technology cradles your foot while you walk which helps reduce stress on your joints. Dr. Daughtry is a fan of this pick as well, noting that “the overall arch support and thicker outsole offers more cushioning and shock absorption than other traditional, basic slides.” What our tester says: “These are like rocking chairs for your feet—they support your feet with heel-to-toe support, are easy to walk in and provided comforting relief the moment I put them on. After a long day of standing on concrete, wearing these slides made my tired feet feel energized and pain-free.” The arch support and curved sole encourage smooth heel-toe transitions as you walk. Becky Eaton for Forbes Vetted Most Comfortable Foam Slide Crocs: Envelopes The Foot With Cloud-Like Comfort Amazon Crocs Mellow Recovery Slide Our score: 10 | Sizes: 2M/4W to 15M/17W | Colors: 7 total, including White and Varsity Red | Materials: EVA As its name suggests, the Mellow Recovery Slide is all about relaxing the muscles of your feet, especially after a long workout or run. The extra-plush SoftRide foam has a sink-in effect and the raised dots on the footbed give a mini massage. Dr. Daughtry says this pair is an “excellent choice for water activities” since the foam is fully waterproof. Fit note: These have a roomy fit, so you might want to go down one size. What our tester says: “These are my house slippers, meaning I wear them pretty much all day long when I’m working from home. I have a history of plantar fasciitis and I’ve worn Crocs ever since a podiatrist recommended the brand. This slide style required no break-in time and helped heal any overnight stiffness. I also like how the cushy foam wrapped around my foot, and the open toe and side vents kept my feet from overheating.” The Crocs Mellow Slide has side air vents to keep your feet from overheating. Becky Eaton for Forbes Vetted Most Comfortable Lightweight Slide Lululemon: Minimal Design For An Elevated Look Lululemon Lululemon Restfeel Slides Our score: 9 | Sizes: 5 to 12 | Colors: 8 total, including Misty Pink and Burnside Green | Materials: Foam, rubber Thanks to a dual-density foam midsole and a padded, water-resistant fabric strap, the Restfeels aid in foot recovery with a chic, minimal silhouette. The heel-to-toe rubber outsole adds a bit of grip while the strap and molded insole help your foot stay in place when you walk. There’s also a bit of arch support to encourage proper foot alignment. What our tester says: “Comfortable sandals sometimes tend to be bulky, but these Restfeels are an exception. They’re not as supportive as the puffier cloud-like styles I tried, but the lightweight design and minimal profile make a quieter statement . The smooth upper and muted colors feel dressy enough to wear out to a summer dinner without looking too sporty. I did, however, experience a little sweating when I walked outside on a hot day and the matte strap scuffed up a bit in my garden, so I might prefer to wear these indoors.” The Restfeels have a smooth matte texture that can be dressed up or down. Becky Eaton for Forbes Vetted Most Supportive Comfortable Slide Kuru: A Heel-Hugging Fit Kuru Kuru Breeze Our score: 10 | Sizes: 5 to 12 | Colors: 4 total, including Jet Black and Caramel Brown | Materials: Full-grain leather Kuru commonly tops our comfortable footwear lists because of the brand’s focus on ergonomics and the Breeze doesn’t disappoint. With a cushioned heel, arch support and a dynamic sole that flexes with each step, this slide is designed to align your foot. If you have bunions or wide feet, fear not: The criss-cross straps and “overall wider fit accommodates toe and foot deformities,” says Dr. Daughtry. What our tester says: “This pair’s microfiber insole was softer on my feet compared to the foam slides I tested. The lining and leather straps felt soft and breathable, and sweating was not an issue at all. The deep heel cup and arch support—common design features for Kuru styles—made my feet feel hugged and supported. I also liked the slight elevation in the heel that gently stretched my foot, relieving my plantar fasciitis symptoms. My only worry is that the light-colored lining might be prone to staining with extended wear.” Everything from the deep heel cup to the soft living makes these slides comfortable and easy to ... [+] wear. Becky Eaton for Forbes Vetted Most Comfortable Recovery Slide Hoka: Foot-Healing Option Hoka Hoka Ora Recovery Slide 3 Our score: 10 | Sizes: M3/W5 to M14/W16 | Colors: 13 total, including Squash and Vanilla | Materials: EVA Regardless if you’re shopping for a post-race sandal or a comfortable option for everyday wear, Hoka’s Ora Recovery Slide is worth considering. It features dual-density technology, an injection-molded outsole and a sustainable sugarcane EVA midsole, not to mention Hoka’s famous metarocking sole. Dr. Daughtry also likes the “air flow vents for better breathability, good anatomic footbed and excellent cushioning.” This style also has the AMPA Seal of Acceptance, meaning a team of podiatrists agree this shoe promotes foot health. What our tester says: “Once I put this pair on, all I could focus on was how good they made my feet feel. The cushioning is slightly firmer than other styles I tested and the support level was just right, not too hard or too soft, especially when I wore them for multiple hours. The rocking sole, which extends well beyond the foot itself, provided extra protection against toe stubs and truly made each step a smooth experience.” The Hoka Ora Slide 3 has a countoured footbed and an oversized rocking sole. Becky Eaton for Forbes Vetted Most Comfortable Platform Slide Reef: Next-Level Cushion Reef Reef Cushion Bondi Bay Our score: 8 | Sizes: 5 to 11 | Colors: 9 total, including Fog and Black | Materials: EVA If you’re looking for a little height boost in your slides, Reef’s Cushion Bondi Bay do the trick. With a cushy foam sole that’s higher than some of our other picks, this slide is not only lightweight and flexible, it’s also waterproof. Many reviewers say these feel “like walking on a cloud” with a “super solid base,” but some felt unstable while wearing the higher platform sole. What our tester says: “While I like the ‘90s vibe of these slides and very cozy feel, I can see why some reviewers felt a little unstable while wearing them. The cushioning was very soft and my feet sunk in a bit, but when I walked my dog wearing these I felt a little rubbing on the top of the foot and a little wobbly since I’m not used to wearing platforms. I think these would be a fun pick for a summer party where you’re not going to be walking many miles.” The Cushion Bondi Bays give a height boost and a cushioned feel underfoot. Becky Eaton for Forbes Vetted Most Affordable Comfortable Slide Adidas: Timeless Style With A Touch Of Extra Comfort Adidas Adidas Adilette Comfort Slides Our score: 8.5 | Sizes: M4/W5 to M18/W19 | Colors: 24 total, including Core Black and Pulse Lime | Materials: Synthetic outsole, textile lining Adidas has been making sports slides for over 50 years and offers several variations on this classic silhouette. Over 12,00o reviewers have weighed in on the Adilette Comfort Slide, which features a hidden under-strap foam layer for added comfort, and is an “extremely comfortable” option with “superb” cushioning.” The contoured footbed is soft yet supportive and the EVA outsole has a bit of grip to it that comes in handy on wet surfaces. What our tester says: “When I first put these on, I felt immediate comfort with the cushioned sole and the extra padding on the underside of the strap. The squishy sole sinks in quite a bit underfoot and the support felt a little less adequate than some of the other styles I tried. This style is unisex and runs large, so I recommend sizing down. The extra width made my feet slip a little—while they definitely felt comfy, I did notice a little sweating and rubbing.” The Adilette Slide has foam channels under the strap for added comfort. Becky Eaton for Forbes Vetted Most Stylish Comfortable Slide Birkenstock: Chic Details For An Elevated Look BIrkenstock Birkenstock Madrid Big Buckle Our score: 10 | Sizes: 4 to 12.5 | Colors: 10 total, including Black and Soft Pink | Materials: Leather, cork, EVA Podiatrists commonly recommend Birkenstocks for their “contoured cork footbed [that] has an anatomic outline with excellent arch support, deep heel cup and a raised toe bar for the perfect fit,” says Dr. Daughtry. The addition of an oversized buckle amps up the style factor. The more you wear Birkenstocks, the more they form to your foot’s shape, and once you consider the adjustable strap that allows for a custom fit, you might just end up wearing these everyday. What our tester says: “Almost every style of Birkenstocks I’ve tried becomes a favorite and I can’t seem to take this pair off. It has a wider strap than the traditional Madrid sandal—to accommodate the big buckle, I presume—and the extra upper coverage actually made my feet feel a little more secure. I personally didn’t experience any rubbing or blisters with the soft nubuck straps, but some reviewers said they needed a couple break-in days.” The gold buckle adds a touch of elevated style to the classic Birkenstock sole. Becky Eaton for Forbes Vetted MORE FROMFORBES VETTED Here’s Everything You Need To Know About Prime Day Invite-Only Deals By Jordan Thomas Forbes Staff 28 Subscription Boxes For Women Worth Gifting Friends Or Yourself By Fran Sales Forbes Staff Why Trust Forbes Vetted Our team at Forbes Vetted spends hours researching, assessing and testing all kinds of footwear to bring you the best picks, plus we regularly interview podiatrists and style experts to ensure we’re bringing you the most accurate information. The publication of this article was overseen by deputy editor Kari Molvar, who has written about fashion and lifestyle topics for over 20 years. This story was researched, tested and written by Becky Eaton, a freelance writer who has contributed to over 15 footwear stories for Forbes Vetted with a focus on comfortable and supportive styles. For this article, we tapped the expertise of Dr. Elizabeth Bass Daughtry, DPM, DABFAS, FACFAS, for additional advice on find the most comfortable slides. What To Consider When Shopping For Comfortable Slides Shopping for a pair of comfortable slides can time consuming since there are countless options out there. Here’s a few factors to keep in mind to narrow your search. Arch support: Ample support is important in slides, not just for proper foot alignment but also because of how sandals are built in general. A flat style without support could lead to the slide slipping off frequently. “Without being enclosed or hugging the arch or the top of foot, your toes must grip the sole of the shoe to hold it in place,” says Dr. Daughtry. “If the insole is anatomically positioned or the arch of the foot can hug the shoe, less toe contracture can occur.” Cushioning: Adequate cushioning is also key to a comfortable slide. “Many slides can be too thin and flexible and not offer enough shock absorption,” says Dr. Daughtry. If a sandal is too flat, your run the risk of pain or even worse, injury. Look for styles with cushioned soles that support the foot and protect your heels from impact as you walk. Outsole traction: An outsole with good treads is an important feature for comfort, grip and safety. “I think of shoes in comparison to tires,” says Dr. Daughtry. “Shoes are our ‘tires’ and when the tread of a shoe [isn’t adequate], you can skid of out of control just like a car.” In order to avoid a potentially slippery and uncomfortable slide-wearing experience, look for a rubber outsole with good traction. What Makes Slides Comfortable? Slides are a popular sandal option for their ease of wear and breathability features, and many people find them quite comfortable. Some slides also have water-resistant qualities that come in handy during summer months as you encounter sweaty feet and a variety of water-based activities. “As with many things, it’s important to wear them in moderation and for the appropriate activity,” says Dr. Daughtry. “If worn too much, [slides] will not offer enough protection in some circumstances—think hiking in the woods or playing sports—or arch support.” Bottom line: Slides are a comfortable and convenient option, but they should be worn for the appropriate activity to avoid potential issues like tendonitis. Are Slides Comfortable To Walk In? Slides can be comfortable to walk in, but Dr. Daughtry warns they’re not intended for long periods of wear. “Choose the appropriate shoe for the planned activity to avoid development of any issues with your feet,” she says. “Many wear slides for running errands or around the house, and as long as the shoe offers proper arch support and cushioning, [they] can be worn in moderation.” Are Slides Better Than Flip Flops? The slide versus flip flop debate is a personal matter; everyone has different foot shapes, specific needs and comfort preferences. “Depending on the insole of the shoe, in general slides can potentially offer more cushion and support than flip flops,” says Dr. Daughtry. “Many find that flip flops can be less comfortable because of the Y-shaped strap that separates the great toe from the smaller toes.” Some might prefer the between-the-toe strap, however, for added stability or to better accommodate toe deformities and bunions. It’s best to try on multiple styles and assess your personal preference, keeping arch support, cushioning and comfort in mind. news.summary: After testing out a variety of pairs and interviewing a podiatrist for expert advice, we found the most comfortable slides you'll want to wear all summer long.
news.author: Becky Eaton,Contributor

news.title: Best Cooling Mattress Protectors 2024 - Forbes Vetted
news.text: Share to Facebook Share to Twitter Share to Linkedin If you’ve ever tried (and failed) to eat or drink in the bed without making a mess, potty trained a child or had a muddy pet jump up to cuddle, you know the importance of a mattress protector. However, mattress protectors have gained a bad rap over the years—many of them aren’t breathable, trapping heat and making you sweat. The best cooling mattress protectors—like the Brooklyn Bedding Luxury Cooling Mattress Protector—are made with breathable, cooling fabrics but still also offer protection against spills. The best cooling mattress protectors shield against spills while keeping you cool. Illustration: Forbes / Photos: Retailers If you’re not sure which kind of mattress protector you need, this guide can help you decide. But if you’re prone to sleeping hot, definitely choose one with cooling properties. According to Dr. Robert Oexman, sleep researcher and the founder and CEO of Somly, “The mattress protector you use can impact your temperature and the ability of the mattress to work properly.” Best Cooling Mattress Protector Overall: Brooklyn Bedding Luxury Cooling Mattress Protector (Queen) Best Waterproof Cooling Mattress Protector: Bedgear Ver-Tex Mattress Protector (Queen) Best Budget-Friendly Cooling Mattress Protector: Coop Sleep Goods Ultra-Cool Waterproof Mattress Protector (Queen) Best Cooling Mattress Protector On Amazon: Slumberfy Waterproof Cooling Mattress Protector (Queen) Best Luxury Cooling Mattress Protector: Sleep Number Total Protection Mattress Pad (Queen) Best Cooling Mattress Protector For Kids: Nest Bedding 10-Inch Kids Cooling Cotton Waterproof Mattress Protector (Kids Full) Best Cooling Mattress Protector Overall Silky, Cool And Water-Resistant Brooklyn Bedding Brooklyn Bedding Luxury Cooling Mattress Protector (Queen) Materials: Thermoplastic polyurethane (TPU), TitanCool cooling technology and polyester | Depth: 14 inches | Features: Cooling fibers, water-resistance | Encasement style: Fitted sheet | Care instructions: Machine wash cool or warm, tumble dry low Pros: Made with cool-to-the-touch fibers Water-resistant Quiet Cons: May cause fitted sheet to slip off Not completely waterproof Brooklyn Bedding’s Luxury Cooling Mattress Protector is our top pick thanks to its cooling capacity, water-resistance and moderate price point. The protector contains TPU fibers that are hypoallergenic, quiet, water-resistant and breathable. It can also accommodate most mattresses with a 14-inch pocket depth, and has a silky, cool-to-the-touch feel. The protector isn’t actively cooling so much as it’s non–heat trapping—which is still an improvement over many other mattress protectors. So if you need a good mattress protector that helps prevent liquids from seeping on to your mattress but doesn’t make you warmer, this is a solid choice. What the reviews say: Most reviewers are perfectly satisfied with this mattress protector. One says, “Seems to help with cooling on these warm summer nights, plus it has very minimal padding.” Another states, “Fits well and is comfortable, does not hold in heat like others we have used before. Do not notice it is even on the bed. Much better than others we had before.” Best Waterproof Cooling Mattress Protector Completely Waterproof But Highly Breathable Bedgear Bedgear Ver-Tex Mattress Protector (Queen) Materials: Polyester, polyethylene, metallic with polyurethane laminate | Depth: 18 inches | Features: Cooling materials, “Powerband” grip, waterproof | Encasement style: Fitted sheet | Care instructions: Machine wash cold, tumble dry low Pros: “Ver-Tex” technology improves airflow through the protector to prevent heat build-up Powerband keeps the mattress protector in place even on adjustable bases Fully waterproof Cons: Slippery feel makes fitted sheet slide off More expensive than many other mattress protectors The Bedgear Ver-Tex Mattress Protector is a fully waterproof mattress protector—putting it a step above water-resistant mattress protectors in terms of protection against fluids and spills. (And yes, there’s a difference between water-resistant and waterproof—water-resistant materials may allow small amounts of fluid to seep through, while waterproof materials completely prevent fluid seepage.) Additionally, Bedgear’s proprietary “Ver-Tex” technology helps maintain breathability and airflow through the protector so it doesn’t trap heat. This topper also features a “Powerband” elastic band that helps it stay in place on your bed. What the reviews say: Reviewers are happy with the protection the Bedgear Ver-Tex Mattress Protector provides. One says, “First test of mattress waterproof barrier was a great success. Young grandchild had an accident and protector did its job.” Another says, “So far, no complaints. It does what is promised, keeping your mattress protected without the extra heat of other protectors on the market.” However, some reviewers say the protector is a little loud and that the fitted sheet slips off the top. Best Budget-Friendly Cooling Mattress Protector Cool And Fully Waterproof, Under $100 Coop Sleep Goods Coop Sleep Goods Ultra-Cool Waterproof Mattress Protector (Queen) Materials: Polyethylene, polyester | Depth: 15 inches | Features: Waterproof, heat-dispersing | Encasement style: Fitted sheet | Care instructions: Machine wash cold, tumble dry low Pros: Fully waterproof Crafted from breathable and cooling materials Made with certified OEKO-TEX Standard 100 textiles Cons: Makes fitted sheet slip off the bed May be noisy according to reviewers The Coop Sleep Goods Ultra-Cool Waterproof Mattress Protector is a budget-friendly option, clocking in at under $100 for all sizes from twin all the way to California king. And while it’s not the cheapest mattress protector money can buy, it’s also coming from a popular, highly reputable sleep company that’s produced one of our favorite pillows. Its poly fabric cover is woven in a way that allows the protector to breathe and remain cool, and is mounted on a fully waterproof layer. However, reviewers note that it makes their fitted sheets slide off the bed easily. What the reviews say: Reviews of this mattress protector are mixed, with most complaints attesting to how the fitted sheet doesn’t stay on the bed because of how slick the protector is. However, one reviewer says with regard to the protector’s cooling capacity, “It works. I no longer feel like there’s heat being generated underneath me.” Another says, “It did feel cooler than others.” Best Cooling Mattress Protector On Amazon An Inexpensive, Prime-Eligible Mattress Cover Amazon Slumberfy Waterproof Cooling Mattress Protector (Queen) Materials: Polyethylene, polyester | Depth: 18 inches | Features: Waterproof, cooling fabric, hypoallergenic | Encasement style: Fitted sheet | Care instructions: Machine wash cold, tumble dry low Pros: Inexpensive and eligible for Prime shipping Made to dissipate heat away from the body Fully waterproof Cons: Reviewers say it doesn’t stay cool Bunches up easily on the bed This Slumberfly mattress protector is the least expensive of our selections, and it could arrive at your door as soon as tomorrow with Prime shipping. It’s made of a polyethylene and polyester blend, like many other mattress protectors—providing a cool-to-the-touch feel and outstanding moisture resistance. However, reviewers are mixed on the quality of this mattress protector. Some reviewers say it bunches up easily, and one reviewer even says—after a spill—she discovered that hers was decidedly not waterproof. However, this is a good choice if you’re on a limited budget or looking to get a mattress protector delivered quickly. What the reviews say: Despite the negative reviews, many people are still happy with this mattress protector. One reviewer writes, “This protector keeps you cool and is of great quality. Now I don’t have to choose between sleeping hot or risk getting spills and stains on my new mattress.” Another says, “The first thing you’ll notice about this mattress protector is that it’s cool to the touch… Even after a full night’s sleep, the cooling effect of this pad keeps on going, reducing the ‘warm spot’ effect that disrupts your sleep and has you tossing and turning looking for a cooler spot in the bed.” Best Luxury Cooling Mattress Protector Waterproofing And Extra Padding With A Cool Feel Sleep Number Sleep Number Total Protection Mattress Pad (Queen) Materials: Polyester, nylon, spandex | Depth: Not stated | Features: Waterproof, antimicrobial, stain-resistance | Encasement style: Fitted sheet | Care instructions: Machine wash warm with cold rinse, tumble dry low Pros: Feels cool to the touch Has antimicrobial and stain-resistant properties Adds a slight amount of extra padding to the mattress Cons: More expensive than other cooling mattress protectors Some reviewers say it’s not fully waterproof While there is a slight difference between a mattress pad and a mattress protector (and a mattress topper, for that matter), this mattress pad from Sleep Number pulls double duty. In addition to adding a little extra padding to your sleep surface (roughly half an inch), it’s waterproof, antimicrobial and moderately stain-resistant. Made of polyester, nylon and spandex, it feels cool to the touch, and the top of the pad features subtle ribbing that can help promote airflow. However, several reviewers have reported that the mattress pad isn’t actually fully waterproof. And like many other mattress protectors, it’s also slippery—making it difficult to keep a fitted sheet in place. What the reviews say: For the most part, reviews of the Total Protection Mattress Pad are positive. One reviewer writes, “Love the protection, plus it helps me to stay cool at night.” Another says, “Twelve years so far—absolutely perfect protection of our Sleep Number mattress. Not a single, even slight spot or stain on it. Washes well, fits well, adds a little extra padding to the bed.” Best Cooling Mattress Protector For Kids Low-Profile, High-Performance Nest Bedding Nest Bedding 10-Inch Kids Cooling Cotton Waterproof Mattress Protector (Kids Full) Materials: TPU, cotton, polyester, spandex | Depth: 10 inches | Features: Waterproof, cooling materials | Encasement style: Fitted sheet | Care instructions: Machine wash cold, tumble dry low Pros: Fully waterproof Comes in twin, twin XL or full-size Protects the sides of the mattress as well as the top Cons: Can’t read all reviews on the Nest website Who needs a mattress protector more than a kid? Between potty training, snack smuggling, drink spills and kid grime (if you know, you know), a good waterproof mattress protector like this one from Nest Bedding can save your child’s mattress from a slow, stinky and stained demise. As the mother of a hot sleeper, I also appreciate that this protector considers the child’s comfort in addition to the product’s functionality. It features a cool-to-the-touch TPU backing beneath a breathable cotton top. This protector is supposedly rated at a perfect 5 out 5 stars with more than 1,500 reviews, but the Nest website allows access to only a handful of the reviews. I’m a bit skeptical of that perfect score claim, but I’m sure that most people are satisfied with their purchase. What the reviews say: Based on the reviews I could access, reviewers are very happy with this mattress topper. One reviewer says, “Perfect for my toddler. Has protected the mattress after several night time accidents.” Another reviewer states, “Keeps my daughter cool while she sleeps. She’s usually a hot sleeper and complains in the morning, but she’s been getting great sleep.” MORE FROMFORBES VETTED The Uppababy Vista V2 Is $250 Off During The Nordstrom Anniversary Sale By Jordan Thomas Forbes Staff Here’s Everything You Need To Know About Prime Day Invite-Only Deals By Jordan Thomas Forbes Staff Why Trust Forbes Vetted The Forbes Vetted team has assembled a vast library of sleep-related content, including product reviews based on firsthand testing and buyer’s guides. The author of this piece, SaVanna Shoemaker, is an experienced Forbes Vetted contributor. She’s tested and reviewed several bedding products, like the best firm pillows and the best mattress toppers for side sleepers. SaVanna is currently pursuing certification as a sleep and recovery coach. Sleep editors Bridget Chapman and McKenzie Dillon have written and edited numerous mattress and bedding stories for Forbes Vetted. They have tested dozens of mattresses and other sleep products, and have both been certified as sleep science coaches.
